description:
This place is steps from my job, and perfect for a healthy lunch!! I came around 12:30 and the line was almost out the door, the person in front of me mentioned it moved fast so waited it out. 

So glad I did! I had the green papaya bowl and it was AMAZING!! I am trying super hard to keep things long carb and to have an item OTHER THAN LETTUCE as a base is EVERYTHING!! I added the pork, and selected "the standard" for veggies and it was perfect. The jalepenos give it a nice kick, and combined with the creamy "nam nam" sauce its pretty hard to love it. 

I see some reviews mention it is americanized, and lacks flavor...I have to disagree. I felt it tasted good, the pork was moist and I would/will but it again!!
author: Ashlei T.

description:
Good portions, great sauces, and very fresh. 

I've stopped in a couple times for lunch, as this is quite close to my office. The food is quite americanized, but it's all very fresh and well flavored. I normally get the noodle bowl with either steak or chicken. The best part for me is it's AMAZING sauces. They have a great selection and are always quite generous when I asked for additional ones. Service was also super quick and they are always nice. 

Overall, fresh, easy, decently priced. I'll probably be back.
author: Sophie W.

description:
For part two of our weekly office lunch, I decided to try Freshroll. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Thursday, August 2nd around 12:15pm.

Custom Single Freshroll: Special roll with choice of protein and vegetables, Comes with noodles inside by default ($4.49)  
*Grilled All-Natural Lemongrass Pork
*Jalapenos
*Tangy Citrus Ginger: Contains soy sauce
*Vietnamese Vinaigrette
*Mint
*Cilantro
*Pickled Veggies
*Lettuce
*Bean Sprouts
*Cucumber (+$0.49)
*Carrots (+$0.49)
*Jalapeño (+$0.49)
*Mint Leaf (+$0.49)
*Note: no noodles

Since I added so many extras, my roll ended up being $6.45. It was a big freshroll though. I did wish they made the additional fillings less in price as you pay the same thing when you add toppings to their three roll orders. If getting one roll, it should be less, right? Taste wise, the roll was great! I liked the vietnamese vinaigrette as I like nuoc cham. Especially if I add sambal to it. The other sauce was little too thick and creamy for me. My only complaint about the roll is that they put noodles in there when I noted no noodles. I figured they just don't do rolls without noodles, but a coworker noted the same thing and she didn't have noodles in her roll.

I also ordered a Side of Pho Broth: A side of our all-natural chicken pho broth, with white onions, cilantro, and scallions ($2.49) as I adore soup. This was tasty. Clean with a meaty flavor. There wasn't a lot of cilantro, scallion, etc, but I keep chopped green onions in the fridge at work, so I added some for texture.

Based on my enjoyment of the roll, I want to give them four stars. But knocking them down one since my roll had noodles. And for the price of the added ingredients to only one roll. It really should be cheaper.
author: Elena N.

description:
I love the fast food Vietnamese concept and the fact that I can get vegan spring rolls quickly. The spring rolls are generally good with fresh ingredients and perfectly cooked vermicelli noodles, but I docked a star because:

1. The tofu is not as good as the 4th street location. Why? Because it's baked and boring at this location. While not as healthy, the 4th street location fries their tofu and it tastes infinitely better!

2. The long and very slow line during lunch. They should really find a way to get this line moving faster. Otherwise, it moves at snail speed.
author: Christina M.

description: Great food!!! We got Freshroll make your own bowls catered into our office for a lunch party and it was perfect! Everyone raved about it and said we must have this on rotation! The gentleman who delivered was so nice and helpful, they forgot one item and he was very considerate and ran back to get it just in time for the 12pm rush! We will definitely be ordering this again. We did the rice, noodle, and lettuce option with either pork, chicken or shrimp! It was the perfect amount of food for some people to get seconds if they wanted.
author: Tracy S.

description: Blown away by the papaya salad bowl with lemongrass pork!! I'm a die hard Freshroll fan, and can't believe it took me so long to try this (prob bc hard to stray from everything else so delicious on the menu). The papaya salad is so refreshing, and the pork adds the perfect amount of flavor. I had mine with the Vietnamese vinaigrette and really can't get enough. Take my money Freshroll, just take my money.
author: Daisy T.

description: Whenever I'm in the city, I crave eating here. Some might prefer their rolls to be saltier, but I liked being able to taste the freshness of each and every ingredient. I ordered the chicken rolls and the shrimp rolls, but preferred the shrimp for the balance of flavors and textures. The staff are friendly and work quickly to prepare your food. Don't expect gorgeous-looking rolls, but they're tasty. Fresh and healthy food makes me happy and this place did it for me. Can't wait to go back.
author: Lori C.

description: Vietnamese food Chipotle style....The bowl and rolls were good, I enjoyed it.
author: Sunil R.

description:
For someone who was born and raised with Vietnamese food, I would consider this spot almost authentic but a little healthier when it comes to Vietnamese food in the FiDi. 

My go-to would have to be the bowl with vermicelli noodle as the base. Lemongrass pork is the way to go for protein. The "Standard" toppings (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, crispy shallots, pickled veggies, and jalapenos). I get the Vietnamese vinaigrette as the dressing and it tastes very similar to "nuoc mam" The bowl came with a lot of food, and it's only $9.50.
author: Danny L.

description:
I ordered a to-go box of 3 spring rolls: chicken, lemongrass pork, and tofu. The meat and tofu were okay--a bit on the drier side that day, and it seemed like the flavors got lost among the generous portion of veggies and noodles. The peanut sauce was also decent, although more limey than I expected. The meal isn't cheap, but considering SF's prices, it's rather reasonable (~12 for 3 large rolls). 
 
Service was quick and efficient, and you can definitely taste the freshness of the ingredients. Overall a good option if you're looking for a fast and healthy meal near the Metreon area.
author: Crystal P.

description:
Love their spring rolls or noodle bowls with their lemongrass pork! I also love their citrus ginger sauce! so delicious! 

Lunch time can get super busy, but if you go before noon or closer to 1pm, there's less of a wait. The line can take some time because people customize, and sometimes the people assembling take a while, but all in all, if you stay away from lunch hour, it's a great place to grab and go!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
I came here to pick up lunch for a meeting. It has a simple order system online where you can customize each bowl or roll for each person. For myself, I got the lemongrass pork spring rolls with house sauce. It was decent but it wasn't anything super amazing. The lemongrass pork had good flavor, but everything else relied on the extra sauce for flavor. The house sauce was pretty good.

Overall, it was decent for a quick meal, but it wasn't something that I would rave over.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
I frequent this location for lunch and have enjoyed the food. The lines are generally long and move slowly which is disappointing when you're trying to get something quick for lunch in the FiDi. 

Today the cashier accused me of attempting to pass off a counterfeit $20. It wasn't. The manager came over looked at it and said it wasn't yet the cashier kept insisting it was fake! WTF?! 

My suggestion would be for this location to purchase "Counterfeit Bill Detector Pen" ($4.43 on Amazon) rather than allowing this odd personality cashier to subjectively decide that your money looks fake to her, hold me hostage at the cash register while the line of other frustrated customers wait even longer to get their own food. Pathetic!

If Freshroll has a goal to alienate their customers, then this woman is "doing a heck of a job."

I'm happy to go to any of the hundreds of other lunch options in the area and give THEM my $$$.

Why should anyone put up with being treated like a criminal by a minimum wage cashier at Freshroll?

good riddance!
author: Michael B.

description:
Didn't bring lunch and forgot to order a meal pal today so I decided to go here. I decided t order a chicken bowl with everything besides jalapeños with Vietnamese vinegairette. Then head back to the office. Started eating my the salad, then took a small bite of the meat just to realize it was PORK! I'm allergic to pork! I get bad stomachache! I hate returning food since it  I know it'll be thrown away and another was the dread of walking back wasting 15 mins but I had no choice! Now I'm sitting in my office with a stomachache because I ingested a small amount of pork. Ughhh!

Get the order straight! It's not that difficult!
author: J M.

description:
Freshroll is located at my old stomping grounds. Things sure have changed quite a bit since I worked in this area. The line here moves quickly as they follow a "Chipotle style" ordering system. The menu is easy to navigate and you're able to mix and match the rolls as well. I decided on the Lemongrass Pork as that one looked the most appealing to me. I was absolutely right because the first bite was delicious. I went with the "standard" fillings and extra jalapenos for that perfect kick. There are several dipping sauces but I decided to go with something traditional, Grandma's Peanut Sauce. I think that one is by far the heaviest on the calorie count but who's counting anyway? Haha. I also tried the taro chips as they looked very crispy and light. They were deep fried and did not taste a least bit oily. Taro is good for you! I would snack on that over a bag of potato chips any day.

There is also an option to order online. If you hate waiting and want to make a b-line for the cashier, give it a try. Otherwise if you're not in a hurry the line moves rather quickly. 

It was such a nice day that I decided to eat out. If you decide to dine in there are limited tables here. It can also get pretty stuffy so I would advise that you take your meal to go.
author: Tim G.

description:
Terrible service, the manager is right there watching employees play w their phones instead of helping customers.

Also dirty w brooms right by the food
author: Ryan R.

description:
Food 8/10
Space 8/10
Service 7/10
Price point 7/10

Delicious fresh lunch spot! but $2 for a side of pho broth or $1 for three shards of green onion is cray. Service was a bit slow, but I'm used to NY speeds. Roll portion was perfect, but i think broth should be a dollar no more. 

Giving a conservative rating of 3 because I found a piece of the blue cloth fiber in my rice skin. They wipe down the boards with blue microfiber cloth sometimes after each use and it falls apart on the board. I think they should be rinsing the board after each use, not wiping.
author: Danbi L.

description: Food is good. Service however needs some improvement. Lines are almost always long so if you're here on a quick break forget about it. Takes about 20 to 25mins to be in and out. The times I've been here I've almost always had to repeat my order 3 to 4 times which is ok the first time but not everytime. Seems like there's a lot of new staff too. Over all I'll still come get food here but I'll make sure to have extra time.
author: Yunuel G.

description: Liked the solid construction of the 3 rolls vs. 1 giant one.  Held together great and was a good amount of food while not being too heavy given the thin rice wrap.  Good ingredients.  Couldn't find any fault.  A nice choice when you want some meat, but feel like a little bit of healthiness in the vegie department as well.  had 2 pork and 1 chicken and both good.  Definitely needed the sauce for dipping since was a bit dry but one was enough, chili sauce.
author: Marc S.

description:
I really love the original Freshroll location on 4th Street after many visits (and I've given it a 4 star review!), so I was unpleasantly surprised that this location was so different. 

Some pain points that I've never had at the Freshroll on 4th:

- Lack of speed: Both locations get lines, which I don't have a problem with in and of itself. But this one could definitely use some improvement in their assembly line because it takes them a lot longer to get the food together.
- Undercooked vermicelli noodles: Had a really weird rubbery texture that made it clear that they weren't cooked properly
- Gristly pork: Freshroll's pork is one of my favorite things because it's usually super flavorful and tender, without being fatty. This wasn't the case here. The meat was gristly from fat and so disappointing.
- Stingy on the meat: I got at least a third less meat than what I usually get :(
- Stingy on the sauces: The other location has bottles and bottles of all of their homemade sauces, so you try them all and use as much as you want. Not here. You're limited to 2 small sauce containers, or else you pay extra. 

Next time, I'll stick to 4th Street.
author: Sara L.

description:
As an actual Vietnamese person, I would actually consider this place almost authentic --- IF you know what to order.

I get the bowl with a 1/2 vermicelli and 1/2 salad base. Lemongrass pork (good! wish it was heated). The "Standard" toppings (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, crispy shallots, pickled veggies, and jalapenos). I get the Vietnamese vinaigrette as the dressing. 

This combination is almost exactly what I would have if my mom was making it for me, except they don't have all of the various mint leaves that I would typically put in there. The Vietnamese vinaigrette is pretty much the mixed fish sauce dipping sauce that you'd get at any Vietnamese home, but here, it is more watered down and not as spicy.

I have never tried any of the aioli's or other sauces here, so I have no idea how those taste. They are also likely not "authentic."

So am I okay with this chipotle-style Vietnamese place even though they might serve a little bit of stuff that isn't authentic? Totally okay with it! It's still super tasty, and if you want to go pretty authentic, you can do that here. Also glad that they are putting other types of Vietnamese food on the map other than your typical pho joint. The bowl is a lot of food, and it's only $9.50! If you get all noodles as a base, I'm sure you can even split it into two meals.

Place your order online to skip the line!
author: Jacqueline V.

description:
Good place to eat if you want something clean and light. The bowls are more food, but I like the aesthetic of the rolls (lol). They're sort of messy to eat, but they're satisfying and make you feel like you're not going to die early.

The first time I went, I asked for jalapeños. Regrets. I had to run to sharetea to calm my burning insides. If you're not thaaaat into jalapeños, I'd avoid getting the spicy option.
author: Serena J.

description:
This place is awesome. I'm half Vietnamese and always worry about finding a good banh mi. This spot is the bee's knees. I got the pork banh mi and the meat was so tender and flavorful. All the trimmings were there, and the bread was toasted to absolute perfection. Prices are very reasonable and worth what you're getting. 

They also had a variety of sauces and a jasmine tea lychee drink that blew my mind. I LOVE lychee. Please order this drink, no matter what else you get! 

I'm not in SF often but this will definitely be on my list of places to go. I've already recommended it to a few people I know who live nearby! :)
author: Jaimie C.

description:
Instead of going to Equinox I was eating a huge burrito on the steps in front of it and saw some skinny gurl eating 3 tofu fresh rolls. She then had the nerve to ask me where do they even serve high calorie burritos? Like omg, this was my leftovers from last night. Anyways.... 

To prove that I can eat something that is not juror, I finally tried this fresh roll place and thought it was good and a quick bite! Also the line is pretty long, I guess it takes some waiting to look good :( After you hit the front of the line, you can get a spring roll, a bowl, a Banh  (choice of one of five proteins--extra charge for shrimp and steak). Honestly, I don't think it's necessarily healthy but it's a quick and not too heavy meal for lunch. I definitely recommend the pork or the Tofu! And if you are gonna do spring rolls -- do the 3 roll combo. It's 3+ each roll if you get singles, so might as well go big! 

Pair this with their great selection of sauces - ginger, peanut, soy sauce lol, this cool sauce called sriracha and you got yourself a full meal!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: I was so excited to try this place because I've been obsessed with fresh spring rolls lately and it definitely didn't disappoint. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered a single roll with crispy tofu, pineapple, cilantro, carrot, jalapeños, and crispy onions with peanut dipping sauce. It was a good portion and one of the most flavorful freshrolls I've ever had. I liked it so much I wanted to come back for dinner but sadly wasn't able to :( If we had this chain in LA, it would quickly become my go-to spot.
author: Melissa G.

description: I like this place. Sometimes the line can be long and sometimes the service isn't the best but it's a solid option to get a somewhat healthy meal to go.
author: Betty L.

description: I went into Freshroll today during the lunch rush, the line was long but they got orders out at a decent time. They got bowls, sandwiches, and freshrollllls. I got the bowl with some extra protein, the customer service was all right. The food was delicious!
author: Sami M.

description:
This place is a good option for a healthy lunch but man, the lines are long! This is basically Chipotle-style Vietnamese food. I got the spring rolls with the baked tofu, bean sprouts,  carrots, cucumbers, shallots and mint with a peanut dipping sauce. I like that you have the option to customize your toppings. 

However, I gave two points off because: 1) the baked tofu sorely lacked flavor and lacked the beautiful brown crust and 2) they could have been more generous with the veggie filling. 

This is a great concept and it's near my work so I'll probably visit again but there are a few points for improvement that could be made including 1) speeding things up, 2) marinading the tofu and baking to a beautiful brown color and 3) not skimping on my veggies...a vegetarian's got to eat.
author: Joan S.

description:
Pretty good spot for relatively cheap food that's tasty and filling but not heavy. I came here for dinner the other day, and I knew I wanted to try both their spring rolls and their bowls. So I got both. But let me just say that if you decide to get both, you're looking at about $20 worth of food. You definitely get a very generous amount of food, but it's way too much for one person. I finished one spring roll and about 3/4 of the bowl. The ingredients in the spring rolls and the bowls are pretty much the same (you pick the meat and toppings), so unless you're craving rice or noodles, I'd say go with the spring rolls. 

The spring rolls are MASSIVE. I got the chicken and the beef, and both were delicious! The meat isn't super tender or anything, but the chewy noodles and the skin of the spring rolls balance it out. The meat has a lot of flavor, and the toppings (I went with the Standard set) make the whole spring roll taste light and refreshing. I can't remember all of the toppings that came with the standard set, but they included bean sprouts, cilantro, pickled carrots/radish, and crispy onion flakes. It was delicious! Bowls were pretty much the same thing except with rice. Not as unique as the spring rolls, but it was still good!

Food here averages around $9, which isn't bad for the amount of food that you get. The line moves pretty slowly, but it's kinda cool watching them make your food. I'll be back!
author: Ashley Y.

description: Ordered online. The food was ok, not that's great. I ordered Vietnamese coffee, and their noodle. They forgot the straw, fork and spoon. I tipped them so it was kinda pissed me off because of their unprofessionalism. Left me in the situation to find utensils to eat when I didn't have time and no where to go.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Our favorite healthy lunch place in SF. Lines are long but they so move pretty fast, so don't get intimated. When we cant decide where to pick up lunch on a busy work day, we unanimously agree on FreshRoll.

Pick a roll or bowl or sandwich, pick your protein, toppings and sauce. Its that simple. I like their pork and chicken, pork being my go to option. Try their grandma's peanut sauce for sure. Oh oh, forgot to mention their side of pho, yummilicious!! Dont miss it. 

Highly recommended for a quick grub in downtown SF!
author: Sujeesha V.

description:
Damn, I love me some Freshroll but this location must be the training ground for the other locations or something. In the fourth street location it's like a well oiled machine and I wouldn't be surprised if they couldn't do 20+ orders in a minute or something. 

In this location, which was just as busy, it was like watching paint dry to get food. 

They also don't leave the sauces out like they do at other locations- sorry guys but what if I want a little extra bit of grandma's peanut sauce? I'm not paying 50 cents extra for that! Leave it out so the people can dress how they like. 

The silver lining is that the food is still consistent with other locations, so if you're willing to wait then you'll still get the awesome Vietnamese flavors they're known for.  I would recommend ordering ahead online so that you don't waste your whole lunch hour waiting around.
author: Elliott W.

description:
As someone with a legitimate food allergy, I have to be somewhat careful when I eat anywhere.  I also realize this is somewhat of a burden for restaurants to incur, so when I eat out, I try my best not to make their job more difficult than it needs to be.  That being said, not everyone that serves or makes food in places like this will be knowledgeable about their ingredients.  I stopped in recently to order some food, but stating very clearly, my allergies, and asking twice, if the meat was marinated in anything containing ingredients that were not safe for me.

After I received my food, I took a few bites, and thought it really tasted too good.  Then my symptoms started.  I went back to the counter and asked someone else if the meats where marinated in soy sauce (one of my known allergies).  If you have allergies to soy or gluten, be extra careful when you ask the people working the counter.
author: David Y.

description: They got my to go order wrong. I paid extra for papaya salad and got regular noodles instead. Left and went back to a work mtg and had no choice but to eat it.
author: Christina V.

description: Terrible rude service the last 3 times I went in.  They nickel and dime you to the point that it's beyond insulting.  Most recently I was told that if I wanted the standard toppings, but with mint instead of the fried shallots, I needed to pay it was either .50 or .75 more.  INSANE.  A leaf of mint costs me money?  When you're saving cost on the shallots? I've asked for this exact order several times and was never given guff over it.  That's petty and I won't give my business to a petty, overpriced shop with mediocre food. There are about 5 other places within a block radius where you can get fresh rolls for cheaper and with friendlier service.
author: Emma H.

description:
Wanted to have a "fun lunch" on Friday, but also wanted it to be sorta healthy. I keep walking by this place and was intrigued. I was not super sure I would like it.

It is very Chipotle-like - pick what format you want: bowl, salad, roll, or sandwich. Then what protein, then what toppings (you can go their standard - NO substitutions) or pick 5. Then add jalapanos and pick what sauce at the register.

I choose rolls, with lemongrass pork, NO sprouts - with jalapeños. (apparently you get 2 sauces with the rolls, I got peanut and ginger). I knew I would love the peanut - the ginger was a surprise and I might have even liked it more than the peanut.

You get three rolls - really 2 were plenty, so I wish you could order less rolls for less money.

I don't LOVE salads, but I enjoy a sandwich very much, these rolls are more salad than sandwich and I though it was a lovely healthy-ish Hybrid of sammy/salad lunch. I will definitely be back.
author: Amy W.

description:
20 minute wait for chipotle-style bowl/spring roll or sandwich. 

pros: 
+ healthy options
+ lunch under $10 

cons: 
- 20 minute wait
- mediocre sauces

$9.50 for 3 Chicken Spring rolls. Not bad, enjoyed the pickled vegetables - but the sesame ginger dressing and the vietnamese vinaigrette weren't anything out of the ordinary. 

TLDR? Decent food but wait is atrocious. Would take Dragon Eats spring rolls over this place.
author: Kristie C.

description: I'm a huge fan of the other feshroll (on 4th street) and thought I'd give this one a try since it's closer to my work. Boy, was I in for a disappointment though. The shrimp smelled very fishy and off (it seemed to be almost raw) and the spring roll wrappers were very rubbery. Usually, when you ask for extra shrimp they are only supposed to charge you $4 in addition to the $9 rolls. However, at this location they charged me $7 extra claiming that they have to charge the original $2 for shrimp at all. What a rip off - especially after the made my roll! Won't be coming back here.
author: Sam M.

description: I am a meat lover and Fresh Roll does their meat right. The lemongrass pork is phenomenally marinated and seasoned and reminds me of when I lived in Vietnam for 2 months helping my aunt bbq her pork for Com Tam (broken rice) which she sold off a make shift stand. The fresh vegetables help alleviate much of the guilt associated with grab and go foods. Make sure you try the Nam Nam sauce on the sandwich.
author: Tony H.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place?!? 

My go-to: 3 fresh rolls (2 tofu + 1 chicken) + jalapeno but no crispy shallots 

I have to knock off one star because the tofu has been a little flavorless. As a result, I have been getting 2 chicken + 1 tofu. 

There is definitely a line here almost always but during lunch hours in downtown SF this is expected. Plus, for me personally, the line is well worth the food that I get to enjoy. 

I basically got my entire team hooked on this place and its now part of there rotation during the week.
author: Elim K.

description: Kinda disappointed in this one. First of all coming into the store I thought I was ordering Pho, but it was really hard to understand the lady behind the counter. I ended up getting a chicken bowl which has noodles and vegetables and the chicken. I found out you can order Pho broth for extra, but just one wasn't even enough to make it into a soup. At this point my meal was about $15 bucks which was way too expensive for the food. The meal itself wasn't half bad but it woulda been better at the very least at $10! I enjoyed the chicken, but probably would be hesitant to come back anytime soon. I will say the sandwiches actually looked good, so if I do return I would try that one!
author: James R.

description:
ROLLS ROLLS ROLLS. Fast and easy if you want to get your Vietnamese fresh rolls.

My co workers & I love coming here, it is literally a 3 min walk from our office. We always get the fresh rolls and then you can choose a choice of pork, chicken and shrimp. I usually get the chicken, they marinate it really well. Then I get it with lettuce, crispy shallots (a must), bean sprouts and pickled vegetables. They sometimes add TOO much lettuce and make your spring roll look fat, you can ask for less. You get to pick your choice of sauce, highly recommend the ginger sauce, it compliments very well!

There is another location that serves pho. Kind of wish they served pho in this location also since they already have the ingredients there.
author: Natalie L.

description:
So yummy! And decently priced for FiDi lunch, quick, and feels at least a little healthy. 
Format is similar to Chipotle: pick how you want it, pick a meat and then your toppings. 
Highly recommend the pork!
author: Anne P.

description: High quality healthy ingredients for a quick lunch or grabbing a meal on the way home. Such reasonable prices for big portions! The shrimp is cooked to perfection and the sauces and sides are yummy and consistent. Great option for those looking for something funny and yummy that won't stretch your wallet or your waistline.
author: Laurel M.

description: Definitely try the spring rolls with avacado.its a great place for vegans too. I love the in house lemonade it's delicious and during busy weekday lunch time the line moves fast so good place for u if u in a hurry
author: Neo R.

description:
One of the go-tos in my lunch rotation. Even though it is a little further from my new office, it is worth the walk. Great spot for healthy, fresh tasting Vietnamese food. I would recommend going as early as you can before the lines grow.

Food - 5/5
I generally go with the pork vermicelli bowl. You get your choice of pork, chicken, or shrimp along with preset toppings (everything no subs) or a pick 5. Im picky so I do the pick 5. Once the bowl is assembled you get to pick your sauce and I always go with the peanut sauce. 

Service - 3/5
The lines get really long, but moves at a moderate pace because food assembly takes time (think Chipotle, but with Vietnamese food). They could probably use am extra person to help with orders.

Ambience - -/-
This is pretty much a to go place, so there is very limited seating. Not a place to come with a group. Everything is clean and what you would expect from a hip place downtown.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Great place for Vietnamese food in Fidi. This place is basically the Vietnamese version of Chipotle. If you're looking for an affordable, quick and healthy fix this is the place for you. 

I just beat the lunch rush when I got here and so glad that I did. There are only a few tables inside so if you're not one of the lucky ones to grab a chair you'll have to find elsewhere to enjoy your meal. 

I got the bowl with lemon grass pork and the peanut sauce. They give you unlimited sauces so try as many as you can! 

Will come back to try their other dishes since the bowl was super refreshing and filling.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Got food from here for the office and my salad had a moth in it! Disgusting.
author: Katherine R.

description: Oh my goodness!! I just love the fresh rolls with the crunchy added!  I also think there pho broth is some of the best I've ever had. This place is very popular at lunch time, so I strongly encourage folks to order for pickup before you go. Even if you eat it there, you'll save at least 10 minutes of time by ordering ahead. It's also pretty inexpensive for lunch in San Francisco. One of my most favorites and I haven't had a bad meal from there yet!
author: Ola P.

description:
Another Chipotle-esqe fast casual restaurant, this one focusing on Vietnamese food with summer roll, sandwich and bowl options.  I like summer rolls and I really appreciate the freshness of them being made to order.  Overall, a good experience except for the protein seeming a bit too skimpy and too room temperature.

Fresh Roll with "The Standard" & Crispy Goodness: The Standard is pretty standard, essentially the same mix of veggies and noodles you'd expect from a traditional Vietnamese joint.  The Crispy Goodness is a pastry wrapped scallion that runs the whole length of the roll and adds a scattering crunchy texture to each bite.  It's kinda like having a mini spring roll hidden instead of a summer roll.  I'm a fan of texture mixing, so I liked it.

Lemongrass Pork: Liked the marinade.  Probably would have been better if warmer.

Grilled Chicken: Didn't really stand out, was kind of boring protein.

Crispy Tofu: Had a smoky marinade.  Though it was fried, it wasn't really that crispy... at least not compared to the Crispy Goodness.

Grandma's Peanut Sauce: Like the typical peanut sauce, but less thick and peanut buttery.  I've had better.

Citrus Ginger: Appears like a salad dressing, but also like a really tangy dipping sauce.

Chicken Pho Broth: Refreshing, kinda like bone broth before bone broth was a fad.  Might have had a bit too strong a cinnamon taste though.
author: Adam B.

description: Got ignored by all sales and had hard time to find a table/seat for eating! Got the worst service in the entire financial district!
author: Ivy Y.

description:
Just in time for the much anticipated opening of the spanking new Target Express, Freshroll decided to open a second outlet right across the street. I do ask myself what my life has become when I get excited about the imminent opening of a mini-Target, but then I see Jamie W.'s palpable excitement and realize I am not alone in my cloistered suburban sensibilities. After all, the big breakthrough was when Target opened at the Metreon revitalizing a retail space that previously looked like a prime candidate for the wrecking ball. Perhaps following the same path, Freshroll looks like it's trying to duplicate its own success at the Metreon by arriving on Bush where ironically another like-minded chain, Freshii, previously failed.

Judging from the opening week queues, the reality is that there is a built-in appetite among FiDi workers for their Chipotle-style operation. One marginal disappointment with this specific location is that they weren't able to secure a permit to allow them to make the pho bowls. They can sell you the chicken pho broth for what it's worth at $1.99 but not the whole shebang. So I had time to ponder my alternate strategy while in line with the overhead menu front and center (photo: http://bit.ly/1Aa0i73). I decided to go for the $8.49 Specialty Rolls, a trio where I could sample the Lemongrass Pork, Roasted Chicken and Baked Tofu at the same time (photo: http://bit.ly/1MkcOGX). The "standard" packaging would suit me fine - lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumber, crispy shallots, pickled veggies and jalapeños.

I threw caution to the wind and paid the $0.99 surcharge for avocado, and to top it off, among the four sauces they offered, I went with the richest one, Grandma's Peanut Sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1E0GioO). Wait, there's more. I also ordered a $1.99 bag of their Homemade Taro Chips to add a little sweet crunch to my lunch (photo: http://bit.ly/18u6Nd7). When I got back to my office to gorge on it, I have to admit I was surprised I enjoyed it, especially the roast chicken selection, since my memories of their Metreon operation are less than charitable when I tried the salad bowl on a couple of occasions there. I have yet to try those here or the sandwiches, but I probably will and hopefully won't be disappointed. Meanwhile, the three roasted chicken rolls will do me just fine.

FOOD - 4 stars...the rolls rock for a lunchtime option amid the salads and sammies in the immediate vicinity
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...tight quarters for dining in but just fine for a take-out spot
SERVICE - 3 stars...new, enthusiastic and predictably programmed
TOTAL - 4 stars...a chain that appears to be improving over time by following Chipotle's success formula
author: Ed U.

description: You know those places you walk by and are like "I want to try that place sometime b/c there is a long line and it must be good". Initially I was just going to get the spring rolls but the pork bowl sounded too darn good and it seemed like a majority of the customers were ordering that so I made an executive decision and changed my mind at the last second.  As others have alluded too it fits the Chipotle, Poke Bowl  model and it's pretty darn good !  The line does move pretty slowly however and the price is decent but not great. I will be coming back here for sure for lunch when I don't pack my rabbit food.
author: Rod M.

description: Corporate feeling, but still a decent go-to. It's like the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. I still get in the mood for it from time to time. You get a lot of food for a pretty good price.
author: Dexter H.

description:
1) they take FOREVER to make anything, thus the line moves at a snails pace. 

2) the apparently can't find the AC button, so needless to say I had to bounce without ordering lunch because the needlessly long wait was not even bearable. 

1st experience was horrible.
author: Jared C.

description: This place is a great FiDi lunch spot. Reasonably priced and generous portions. I always get the pork rice bowl, and it's excellent every time. Definitely wait until after 1 PM to go - the line is crazy long from 12-1.
author: Annie S.

description: I had been craving spring rolls for a while and a coworker suggested I try Freshroll. I read the reviews and since there was plenty of warning about the long line, I placed my order online for pick up. I decided on the grilled chicken (am looking forward to trying the shrimp next time) with mint, lettuce, and I forgot what other greens. For sauce I had the namnam & vinegar. The namnam is SOOOO GOOD. The rolls are extremely filling, I was good with two. The service was great. No waiting since I had ordered online and there's a separate line for pick up. I will deff be coming back! :)
author: Yanet P.

description:
Tried this place for lunch and overall experience was good..
The concept is serving line where u pick protein, sandwich/roll/bowl/salad and dome toppings and sauce types.
The cuisine is Vietnamese and has good flavors and sauces..
I tired the sandwich which came with grilled cubed chicken, proprietary sauce and pickles, salad mix, cilantro and jalapeno..
author: dharmesh p.

description: Umm... so why did I go to the "Subway" version of bahn mi??? I get it, not going to be legit but come on! Toasted stale bread so you basically get a rock with stuff flopping out the side. When I saw a hotel buffet toaster that puts out about as much heat as a hair dryer I should have walked out.  Chunks - not slices - of Asian-y meat (they put lemongrass in the title so you know, it counts, right?) A massive handful of cilantro and carrot/radish pickles to try to add some moisture. And look up, a wall of Siracha so you can drown out the taste of the other bland ingredients. So continental! A waste of $8 bucks.
author: Bobby B.

description:
A solid place to get tasty Fresh Spring Rolls.  The base price is now $9.49 for 3 big rolls, or a bowl.  It's a healthy and filling lunch.

The ingredients are fresh and good, and the line moves pretty fast.

You can get some tasty Pho broth for $1.99.  Until today, I only thought you could get the broth in a separate container.  Today, I learned that they will ladle the same amount of broth into your bowl (if you want that).

My only wish, based on tasting the broth, is that they would add Pho Bowls with all the trimmings.
author: Roy C.

description: Found more than 10 fruit flies in my vermicelli bowl, which I spent $13 on. Will NOT be coming back.
author: Cassandra P.

description: Was in the city on business and stopped by here after checking Yelp for decent lunch spots. I'm not Vietnamese, but I grew up the Bay and have been eating the food for years. Tried the pork spring rolls off the menu and was pleasantly surprised; tasty, fresh and actually filling. Check em out.
author: Ryan C.

description: Visited on our vacation at the recommendation of a local. Great place and fantastic fresh bowl combinations! Get the yum yum sauce!
author: Beth B.

description: This place has amazing food! The fresh rolls are amazing, and the sauces are as well. The service is welcoming and accommodating! The line can be a bit long, though. We came at around 1 and the line was short, but it picked up right around the time we left. The downsides are that the wraps can be sticky and there isn't a place to wash your hands, and that the menu has only 3 real meal options, with different combinations of ingredients. Even so, the food is so fresh and original!!!
author: R T.

description:
I used to like this place and I used to visit the location at the metreon pretty frequently.  I haven't been in a while and this is my first time at this location.

I've been to the other one since they changed the format and limited the veggie choice and got rid of some of the veggies, so I'll gripe a bit on here about that since I just had it again today.

I start with the negatives, the price has gone way up from where it used to be.  They also limited the veggies and got rid of one of my favorites (red bell pepper).  They limited the sauces to two small sauces.  At the other location, they used to have the sauce on the outside and you could put whatever you want on it.  I also had a few pieces of meat that were all gristly and un-edible.  I know that can happen from time to time, but it definitely didn't help with my experience.  The line moves pretty slowly as well, but that isn't their fault.

The positives, the veggies are fresh, the food is pretty tasty, the service is nice.

I wish they went back to how they used to be.
author: Ty C.

description: This is a modern Vietnamese fast food, where they assembly your custom Vietnamese rice or Rice Vermicelli Bowl or Spring Rolls. The general concept is just like Chipotle but it is Vietnamese food. The lines moves slow and there are usually a lot of people during lunch time. I got the pork over brown rice with everything on it along with two sauces I picked. Overall, it is fresh, light and unique. They also have Vietnamese coffee so that is a bonus. Will be back for more when I don't feel like a greasy sandwich or light salad.
author: Athena C.

description:
gotta be honest, the food is ok if you have no other vietnamese options, but you can find tastier, larger and cheaper portions within a 2 block radius

Ban Mi; to to Latte Express on Kearny and Clay (the bread alone is 100x better) 

vermicelli bowl; many options... but one of the most hidden I'd say is the little cafe on Sansome and Sacramento 

pho; several good options, there is a place by redwood park on Washington/Sansome, or at the west end of the park in chinatown (Golden Star) 

so... for convenience, ok, do fresh roll if the line is very short, otherwise, hit up a local mom/pop type shop
author: Beth P.

description: My favorite place to go to for lunch! It's healthy, fresh, and the sauces for the rolls or bowls are so good. I usually get 3 rolls with the standard(lettuce, bean sprouts, jalapeño, cilantro, cucumber, pickled radish) noodles, and chicken with their vinaigrette and ginger sauce. So delicious, filling, and decently priced.
author: Lisa C.

description: Think of eating a bunch of delicious spicy pork wrapped with veggies, sprouts and lettuce in a rice wrap.  Then dip it into a sweet chili sauce or a tangy vietnamese fish sauce. (nuoc mam you know what I mean? mmm)   It's so good. It's fresh. It's Vietnamese. How does it get any better than that?
author: David Z.

description:
So I've stopped here for lunch a couple of times but I actually tend to order delivery from Freshroll more than visiting them. It's great because when I'm lazy but want something semi healthy their vermicelli noodle bowls are the BEST!! Caviar is what I use to get the noodle bowls delivered and I tend to get the chicken vermicelli bowl with all the toppings and the vinaigrette. It's basically a refreshing noodle salad. MMMMMMmmmmm! HEALTHY DELIVERY!!! 

They also have a delicious Pho. Their broth is really really good. It's surprising because usually pho broth is only good from the whole in the wall spots but this place is healthy and CLEAN! 

If you are looking to get delivery from this place use Caviar. It's reliable and gets you your grub pretty quickly and they have accurate estimates on arrival. Sign up with this link to get $10 off each of your next two orders in San Francisco.: https://bnc.lt/W9Qc/YyjfCD33Nt
author: Meg C.

description: Yet another fast casual made-to-order restaurant, and the the first of it's kind (vietnamese) either. Good location and healthy though so gave it a try. Got the bowl with lemongrass pork -- traditional vinaigrette of course. A little on the sweeter side and tasted more 'thrown together' than anywhere close to authentic. Portion is decent and it does the job. Service and training could be improved.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Typical SF downtown prices... $9+ for three small Vietnanese fresh rolls.  I chose three different proteins (pork, chicken, and tofu) today.  Honestly, the proteins weren't very appealing to me; the meat looked and tasted "boiled" instead of "grilled" and the tofu was dry/hard. Wish they could throw in more of the basic ingredients (lettuce, sprouts, carrot, cucumber, and vermicelli)!

Not sure if I'd come back and definitely not on a weekly basis.  Love the crispy shallots and jalapeños though.
author: Yen F.

description:
I love getting their lemongrass pork rolls. So flavorful! I'll admit I haven't really tried any of the other proteins or ways to hold said proteins, but that's just because I don't want to mess with a good thing. LOL. I also like getting their Vietnamese iced coffee and taro chips. Their limeade was a little too sour for me, but then again, I'm not much of a sour person anyways so it's to be expected. Hahahaha.

The only downside is that the rolls tend to fall apart once you get halfway through one. I can't say for sure if that's a normal thing or not or if it may be due to my own messiness, so it doesn't faze me much.
author: G C.

description:
Let me just start by saying that I am Vietnamese, and I have lived in the most populated area of Vietnamese in the Bay Area (South Bay). I couldn't stop rolling my eyes while eating this and getting super angry bc I just spent $9 bucks for some noodles, veggies and a bit of rubbery protein? NO. What thievery is this? But then I got to thinking... I'm not paying $9 for the food, I'm paying for rent costs! And we all know how ridiculous rent is in SF!  

I do have some positives to this place though! The to-go containers and the peanut sauce were very nice touches to my 3 fat rolls.
author: Sarah N.

description: I would have taken a picture of my meal today, but it was so yummielicious that it disappeared in minutes! Rolls or bowls, this place delivers tasty, fresh ingredients with fun sauces.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I LOVE the Fresh Rolls here, although it's the only thing I ever get I am tempted to try something else but I always give in to the rolls. Typically I get chicken, everything on it and a side of Grandma's Peanut sauce and a small bag of Taro chips.
author: Irma R.

description:
My wife, parents, and I had Freshroll for lunch during a recent trip to San Francisco.  We all agreed that it was delicious!  I had three rolls (shrimp, chicken, and pork) and they were outstanding.  My favorite was the lemongrass pork!  My wife decided to have the chicken in a bowl, which was also another very good choice.  The Vietnamese vinaigrette and citrus ginger sauces both tasted delicious as dressings for the salad.  Finally, my parents had the lemongrass pork as a sandwich.  This too was outstanding.  The bread was nice (not too heavy with the right amount of crispness) and the sandwich tasted fresh: a nice balance of tastes between the pork, NamNam sauce, vegis, and cilantro.  My only regret is that they do not have a location in Arizona where we live. We will definitely return the next time we visit San Francisco.

PS: Don't let the line during lunch fool you.  The service is quick and they are very good at keeping the line moving!
author: Mike V.

description:
I used to frequent one of their other locations, but I've stopped at this location now a few times. If you thought having more locations would mean a reduction in the lines, you thought wrong! Good thing the line moves quickly.

I typically order the pork or chicken rolls with "The Standard" and I have never had a bad experience. Also make sure to load up on sauces before you leave if you're taking it to go!
author: Ian F.

description:
I've always been a Freshroll fan, but recently I started a ketogenic diet thing and have to rediscover all my old favourites. Luckily, Freshroll holds up well. For low/no carb options, go for the bowl with salad instead of noodles or rice. The rest of the veggies and meat options are easy from there out, though you'll want to avoid pineapple (how I miss thee). 

When ordering the salad bowl it would be great if they compensated by adding more of the rest of the veggies IMO.

Today's line up was super minimal at 1:30pm, only 3 people in front of me when I rolled in.
author: Tyler M.

description: Let me tell you something... when you can order online for pick-up before the restaurant opens and choose the time you want to pick up your food, you automatically get great reviews from me! Freshroll allows for pre-ordering before 11am, when they open. In SF, finding great tricks like this save so much time, especially on a 30 minute lunch break. The price is amazing for the area and you can literally tell them what you want in your spring rolls - WIN. You can skip the line, get what you want, pay a decent price... I mean what else do you want?!! YES.
author: Stacy K.

description: Don't know how some people put up with the crappy pho. Pay extra 5 bucks just to get some broth that fills up halfway and super cold. Extremely disappointed.
author: Guea-Yea L.

description:
Freshroll is a great concept and the food was delicious. I chose the 3-roll combo and tried the lemongrass pork, the bbq chicken and the tofu.  The lemongrass pork was really good, as was the chicken.  Not too crazy about the tofu, as it was pretty bland.

I loaded each roll with different toppings so I could try everything.  My favorite topping was the fried shallots - gave the roll a very nice crunch.  All the ingredients are very fresh.

You have a choice of four dipping sauces and I liked the peanut sauce the best.  The fish sauce needs to be "fishier" as someone else mentioned.

Couple of negatives:  the portions are pretty small for the price - my three rolls were nearly ten dollars.  The garlic shrimp looked good, but I didn't feel like spending another $1.50 for the upcharge.
author: .Hon H.

description: Delicious. When I'm at this Freshroll, I usually get the spring rolls with chicken, which seems to be drier on 4th street where I usually opt for pork. The bowl and banh mi are also really good. Avoid the long lines during the lunch rush hour by ordering online (there's a separate line for pick up orders)! http://site.menudrive.com/freshroll
author: Annie S.

description: Returned (twice now) and was impressed. They got it together now and the place is packed. Fish sauce was zingier. Good concept!
author: Andrew K.

description: Absolutely love the rice bowl with a choice of lemongrass pork with basic vegetable (so Asian! I love rice). I always  go for traditional fish sauce as a dipping (every Vietnamese restaurant serve that with rice dishes or rolls). Side order recommended chicken soup! Love love it! Especially on a cold day like today :) I'm glad they have 2 locations opened now. Stop by for a yummy in your tummy if you are in the area.
author: fumiko n.

description: Great Fi-Di lunch that's applying the assembly line concept to Vietnamese cuisine. Great sauces and prices. Don't be scared by a line out the door because they keep it moving.
author: Byron B.

description: Nice rolls. Usually big lines and around 10/15 mns wait . Looks like you can order online and pick up
author: N H.

description: Takes far too long at lunch as the staff are all working on internet orders . Shame, used to be really good but now sliding down
author: Duncan L.

description: Delicious Food.  I ate here and got the noodle bowl for my toddler and freshrolls for myself.  The ability to customize for a picky kid was great.  For me, I ordered chicken rolls with "the standard" topping plus crispy goodness.  Very clean too!
author: Cheryl G.

description: I am upping the score. The quality is really good and this time, i got more meat! so maybe it was a one-off last time. :)
author: R A.

description: I went there with my co worker for the first for lunch and I got the chicken and lemon grass pork. It was quick, delicious and worth it.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
Peppers, bean sprouts are supposed to be placed in another bowel rather than dumping in the noodle bowel. So, the pho was not even close to the average. 

The roll may be good but I do not know.
author: vincent j.

description: Super delicious vietnamese food and fast friendly service. We ordered a sandwich and a bowl. Try out the different sauces!
author: Cecilia D.

description: Fake overpriced viet food and awful service.   Went between 7-8pm on 3/25, the guy working the register needs to be fired asap.   Rude and condescending.  If you want some real viet food go to a real viet place, not this fake chipotle wannabe.
author: Rick N.

description: Great lunch spot in fidi for noodle bowls, banh mi, and spring rolls.  They have great options for protein, including shrimp and their ingredients are super fresh.  At lunch time they have a pretty long line, but its worth it because it moves pretty fast.  Prices are reasonable for the area.  The only downside is that they dont have traditional pho, but they do offer pho broth if you're craving that.
author: Yasi N.

description: So I would have given top ratings since I went here for the last 3 weeks and got lunch every day. However, the last 2 times I have gone with my friend, the amounts have shrank down by 30%. It's literally a $10 bowl of lettuce and noodles but now they are being skimpy on the lettuce and noodles. Also, I get pineapple added and today the pineapple had a mildewy taste to it. So I don't know if management is slacking off or they are trying to squeeze for profit but seems to be going down hill. I probably won't come back since same experience twice now.
author: Bunny C.

description: This place is lovely, the food is delicious, and the staff is very courteous. We stumbled upon this location on a "soft opening" day, and they let us eat for free! A family of four!! We didn't realize it was not open to the general public, but they didn't mind and invited us to stay. Lunch for two adults and two kids (aged 4) would have been under $25 here. Lots of options, and all very fresh food. I'll  go back, and pay next time!! :-)
author: Amylynn F.

description: Freshroll has built up quiet a devout following among my coworkers, myself included. Is it authentic? Probably not. Is it the best freshroll in SF? I don't care. It's delicious, filling and a healthy alternative to a sandwich or other quick lunch options in the FiDi area. You can't go wrong with their rolls -- I recommend the tofu + pork paired with "the standard" and either the vinaigrette or nam nam sauce (not advertised, but just ask for it).  If you're a little crunched for time, order online and pick it up 20(ish) minutes later.
author: Alison S.

description: The noodle bowl was a good balance of carbs, veggies and protein ($8.49). And the people were so friendly.. Each one making sure I had a "great rest of my day".
author: Jane J.

description: Great slightly cheaper lunch option in FiDi area. It's a chipotle style vietnamese place that offers sandwhiches, bowls, and rolls. The sandwhiches have nicely toasted bread and give a lot of meat/pickled veggies for $7.99 plus tax. The standard toppings include sauce, picked carrots and radishes, cilantro, and optional jalapeno. Service is friendly and fast since they have multiple people at the ordering station as well as two cash registers.
author: Kailin L.

description: Came during the lunch rush and first impression was that it reminded me of Bamboo Asia, minus the Japanese and Indian options but with the ability to customize your food. There's three options: roll, sandwich or bowl. You choose your protein, filling and sauces. I got the bowl with lemongrass pork, "standard" fillings and Vietnamese vinaigrette. The line was pretty long and moved slowly, again we came during the lunch hour so it's to be expected, but the food was pretty good. Nothing amazing in terms of flavor but definitely an affordable, somewhat healthy option in the FiDi (which you can never have enough of).
author: Ashley Nicole C.

description: I love their vermicelli noodle bowl with tofu.  The ingredients are always very fresh, and the tofu is seasoned well.
author: Christina S.

description: I like this place.. clean.. fast... easy.... pick your base... they are flexible... I like 1/2 noodles/1/2 lettuce... lemongrass pork and the standard.... I like that they give me a few options with the sauce (I can never make up my mind). Love the vietnamese vinaigrette and the peanut sauce... and love love love their taro chips...
author: Jay S.

description:
eat here for lunch a lot.
kind of addicted
vermicelli w/ pork - how can you go wrong?
long lines but moves steadily
author: Fred C.

description:
They are still working out the "we just opened" issues, but the food is still pretty good. If I had to compare the Fresh Roll on 4th street vs Bush street -- 4th street is better. 

I did notice that they seemed to have changed their "standard" ingredients to take out the pineapple. Maybe it was too pricey for them to keep as a standard item. I do think their fresh rolls are more delicious with the pineapple, and without the jalapenos. 

I typically get the veggie option -- the 3 fresh rolls with baked tofu. I'm not a fan of cilantro, so I always exclude that. 

Hopefully once they get into a good groove, they'll be back up to 5 stars in my book.
author: Janel A.

description: Very clean and great concept of fast Vietnamese food. The location's also awesome, just one block away from my office. OK taste for garlic shrimp bowl - great for Vietnamese food in Financial District, but not impressive. A little over-priced. Small portion.
author: Brenda Z.

description: Great concept but food didn't deliver. They offer all the traditional ingredients in Vietnamese food yet it didn't come together and lacked any type of great flavor. I got the rice bowl with pork and it was extremely generic tasting. The plus side is that they are busy so you know the food is fresh. I will not be revisiting fresh rolls again.
author: Rhonda T.

description: I'm a fan! I get a brown rice bowl with shrimp and chicken or pork. Good flavor, and good combination when you add the different fillings. It's a little expensive, but I get two meals out of it so it's fine. I've been going here once a week since I found it. I've seen the line pretty long, but they're good about getting people through quickly.
author: Brett N.

description: Like their rolls.  I inevitably go for their 3 roll combo - with the shrimp/pork/chicken regularly but tried the tofu 2 days ago and was pleasantly surprised.
author: Eastbay Foodie S.

description: I am a big fan! Simply love the food. I moved out of the city and I miss my favorite lunch spot!!!
author: Mickey M.

description: Got the tofu sandwich, not impress.  Bread was too thick and chewy, tofu was bland, not sure what is in the namnam sauce but it was good.  Not authentic at all.
author: Sasa L.

description: I only order the rolls. Pork is my favorite. Chicken is good. I was not a fan of the shrimp (didn't like flavor) and the tofu was super bland. Fresh ingredients and good portions. They do not charge extra if you ask for a little more noodle or veggies. This place is on my regular lunch rotation.
author: lenka l.

description: Four stars, so yes, I'm a fan. The whole "make your own" thing is super trendy, but as we know from a certain Mexican-ish place, it does work pretty well. So when I discovered this Vietnamese version, I was both excited (cuz it's different) yet slightly cautious (from fear of being offended cuz I love authentic Vietnamese food). I got the lemongrass pork spring rolls with the normal toppings except cilantro, which comes with THREE pretty good-sized rolls. A little heavy on the lettuce vs. the other ingredients, and I wish they were a little more generous with the noodles and protein, but there was still enough of everything to taste. The pork had lots of flavor, noodles were cooked right, the jalapenos had a bite to them, and the peanut sauce, altho not authentic, still tasted like peanut sauce. And the prices are reasonable, especially considering it's a trendy Vietnamese spot in the FinDis. Give it a try... you'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: Darryl Y.
